meanings.definition: Of or relating to a form of poetry in which the second stanza repeats the first in reverse order.
meanings.sent1: The antistrophic poem had the same lines but in a different order.
meanings.sent2: The poet's antistrophic style created a unique and captivating rhythm.
meanings.sent3: The antistrophic verse made the readers pause and reflect on the words.
meanings.sent4: Her writing flowed like an antistrophic river, twisting back on itself.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the antistrophic language lingered in the air long after it was read.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a pattern of alternating or reversing movements or directions.
meanings.sent1: The antistrophic dance routine amazed the audience with its intricate steps.
meanings.sent2: The antistrophic pattern of the waves crashing on the shore was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The antistrophic way the birds flew in the sky looked like a synchronized dance.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts moved in an antistrophic manner, back and forth, unable to settle.
meanings.sent5: The antistrophic motion of the pendulum was hypnotic to watch.
